metadata.title: CVE-2011-3170 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The gif_read_lzw function in filter/image-gif.c in CUPS 1.4.8 and earlier does not properly handle the first code word in an LZW stream, which allows remote attackers to trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, and possibly execute arbitrary code, via a crafted stream, a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-2896.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2011-3170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.5.0-8
cups-bsd - 1.5.0-8
cups-client - 1.5.0-8
cups-common - 1.5.0-8
cups-core-drivers - 1.5.0-8
cups-daemon - 1.5.0-8
cups-ipp-utils - 1.5.0-8
cups-ppdc - 1.5.0-8
cups-server-common - 1.5.0-8
libcups2 - 1.5.0-8
libcupsimage2 - 1.5.0-8
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> This also affects cups 1.5.x and isn't fixed in 1.5.0 gimp was fixed correctly with a single commit, so doesn't have this issue, which is an incomplete fix.

criterions.comment: cups package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.0-8').
swi-prolog package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
